Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of the God's Father of Amun, Bakenkhons, with black detail: a lappet-wig tied with a fillet, an unmodelled face with traced eyes and crossed hands in relief holding two hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of Hieroglyphs; seed-basket on the back.
Curator's comments: The collection contains three other shabtis of the same man (EA 68605, 68606 and 71104). The collection also includes five shabtis in a different style of a God's Father and God's Servant of Amun, Bakkhons, who was probably a different individual (EA 50106, 50107, 71108, 71154 and 71156).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Walter Llewellyn Nash (Executors of)
